page.title: 17EGLOSKERRY VILLAGE. (2)
page.content: The{Post Office}is also a general store, selling food, fruit and vegetables, bread, domestic cleaning materials, toothpaste etc. One hundred years ago it used to be the village pub.In the nineteenth century there was, and still is in Cornwall, a strong teetotal tradition, and many village pubs were bought by movements such as the Rechabites, and turned into domestic dwellings.That is what happened to this building, but it later became the shop and P.O.Further on there is{St. Keri Court,}a group of bungalows for old people with a warden to look after them. Next door is the{Primary School}with 50 children and two teachers, the classrooms being two prefabricated buildings.Fifty metres beyond the school this part of the village ends. The rest is on a road leading south from the church.
